>Yes, but visualization can be made through ordering of neurons by their la=
yers. Firstly we draw
>neurons with "pure" 1-st level (all connections to t=
he input one). Then (a bit further from inputs) only
>those neurons that ha=
ve connections to the 0 and 1 layer only and so on.
>
>And what was your me=
thod?

The same, except we start at the output nodes and move backward.  Th=
e issue is that nodes are going to be placed in the layer corresponding to =
their shortest distance to the input (or output) layer.  So, a node with 10=
00 paths to the input layer that are 4 connections long and 1 path that's 1=
 connection long will wind up in the first hidden layer when it would more =
logically be in the 4th.
